sources.title: MoonoverHarlem
sources.description: MOON OVER HARLEM was shot in just in four days for $8,000. The film packs lots of action, romance, tragedy, music, dancing, and comedy into it's brief running time. The cast includes 20 chorus girls, a 46-member choir, and a 60-piece orchestra. Jazz legend Sidney Bechet appears in the opening wedding scene.

sources.title: ParadiseInHarlem
sources.description: Between swing and blues musical numbers, the story of comedian Lem Anderson, whose long-awaited chance to act dramatically vanishes when he witnesses a mob killing and is forced to leave town. Lem becomes a wanderer, then an alcoholic. Finally a chance to play Othello draws him back to Harlem. - IMDB Description

sources.title: ParadiseInHarlem1939
sources.description: "Between swing and blues musical numbers, the story of comedian Lem Anderson, whose long-awaited chance to act dramatically vanishes when he witnesses a mob killing and is forced to leave town. Lem becomes a wanderer, then an alcoholic. Finally a chance to play Othello draws him back to Harlem. Is it too late for Ned? Or too soon to suit Rough Jackson's mobsters?" (from the IMDb summary by Rod Crawford) There is another copy on the Archive, but this is a different (and slightly higher quality) encoding.

sources.title: Paradise in Harlem (1939)
sources.description: It is the story of a comedian Lem Anderson who dreams of playing in Shakespeare scenes but he is applied only role in Harlem Vaudeville. One day he is the witness of a crime and the mobster strongly advised him to leave the town... Watch on RetroFlix:Â  https://retroflix.org/paradise-in-harlem-1939/

sources.title: Paradise in Harlem (1939) MAMIE SMITH
sources.description:
BLACK HISTORY MONTH
Stars: Frank H. Wilson, Mamie Smith, Norman Astwood 
Director: Joseph Seiden

The story of comedian Lem Anderson, whose long-awaited chance to act dramatically vanishes when he witnesses a mob killing and is forced to leave town.

sources.title: Moon Over Harlem (1939) EDGAR G. ULMER
sources.description:
BLACK HISTORY MONTH
Director: Edgar G. Ulmer
 Stars: Buddy Harris, Cora Green, Izinetta Wilcox

 Edgar G. Ulmer directed this melodrama with an all-black cast, including jazz legend Sidney Bechet. The story concerns a rich widow seduced by a gangster, and the man's attempts to get her money.

sources.title: Paradise in Harlem (1939) Comedy, Drama, Musical
sources.description:
Between swing and blues musical numbers, the story of comedian Lem Anderson, whose long-awaited chance to act dramatically vanishes when he witnesses a mob killing and is forced to leave town. Lem becomes a wanderer, then an alcoholic. Finally a chance to play Othello draws him back to Harlem. Is it too late for Ned? Or too soon to suit Rough Jackson's mobsters? Melodramatic events lead to an unusual conclusion.

Director: Joseph Seiden
Writer: Frank H. Wilson
Stars:    Frank H. Wilson, Mamie Smith, Norman Astwood  
Genres:  Comedy, Drama, Musical

sources.title: Moon Over Harlem (1939) Edgar Ulmer - Crime, Drama, Romance full length film
sources.description:
Musical numbers highlight this story of a wealthy widow who disowns her daughter after a new man enters her life.

Director: Edgar G. Ulmer
Writers: Mathew Mathews, Shirley Ulmer  (as Sherle Castle)
Stars: Buddy Harris, Cora Green, Izinetta Wilcox -
